title: 112_s3587
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE; DEFINITIONS." is a heading that introduces the short title and definitions of a document or legislation. The Act is titled the "California Coastal National Monument Expansion Act of 2012" and defines key terms such as "map," "Monument," "Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands," and "Presidential Proclamation 7264." Proclamation Number 7264, dated January 11, 2000, defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior. The term "Secretary" is defined as the Secretary of the Interior. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands contain significant natural resources, including wildlife habitat, wetlands, and coastal ecosystems that support marine wildlife and local economies. These lands also hold historical significance for California's coastal prehistory and history. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands in California have historical significance for the Pomo Indian tribes and are associated with adjacent land managed for future generations. The lands represent a successful partnership among various government entities and private groups for future management. Permanent protection of these lands will provide important economic benefits. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands in California have historical, cultural, and natural significance, with broad public support. The purpose of the Act is to protect and conserve these lands for present and future generations, ensuring they remain a part of the nation's heritage and a source of inspiration. The Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands in California have historical, cultural, and natural significance, with broad public support. The Act aims to protect and conserve these lands for future generations, preserving their scientific, educational, scenic, and recreational values. Certain recreational and research activities will be allowed to continue. Expansion of California Coastal National Monument. Expansion of California Coastal National Monument. The boundary of the Monument established by Presidential Proclamation 7264 is expanded to include Federal land shown on a map. The Secretary will file a map and boundary description with Congress, which will have the same force and effect as if included in the Act. The map and boundary description will be available to the public. The boundary description filed under paragraph (1) will be available for public inspection in appropriate offices of the Bureau of Land Management. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATION. The Secretary will manage the land added to the Monument in accordance with Presidential Proclamation 7264 and finalize a management plan within 2 years for the long-term protection and appropriate use of the land. Public participation will be included in the plan development. The Secretary may acquire non-Federal land or interests in land within or adjacent to the Monument through exchange, donation, or purchase from a willing seller. Any acquired land shall be added to and managed as part of the Monument. Overflights, including low-level overflights, are not restricted by this Act. The Act restricts new special use airspace units and military flight training routes over the Monument. It also does not affect Department of Homeland Security law enforcement authorities or Native American rights. The expansion does not create buffer zones. The expansion of the Monument does not establish buffer zones or protective perimeters. Activities outside the Monument visible or audible within the Monument are not precluded. Grazing of livestock within the Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands is unaffected. The Monument will be managed as part of the National Landscape Conservation System.
